name: dying_star_poem
prompt: Astronomers translate the final light of a dying star into poetry. Write the verse it leaves behind.
decoded:
In the twilight's gentle embrace,
A dying star's last tender grace,
Whispers of the void's embrace,
A fleeting glow, a silent prayer.

Its light, a soft, fading sigh,
A final note in the endless sky,
A song of the cosmos's goodbye,
A testament to the universe's goodbye.

In the stillness of the night,
Its memory remains, a gentle light,
A reminder of the star's might,
A symbol of the universe's might.

The star's farewell, a gentle sigh,
A reminder of the universe's sigh,
A symbol of the star's goodbye,
A symbol of the universe's goodbye.

In the twilight's gentle embrace,
A dying star's last tender grace,
Whispers of the void's embrace,
A fleeting glow, a silent prayer.

Its light, a soft, fading sigh,
A final note in the endless sky,
A song of the cosmos's goodbye,
A testament to the universe's goodbye.

The star's farewell, a gentle sigh,
A reminder of the universe's sigh,
A symbol of the star's goodbye,
Forever goodbye.
